states.1: variable, from mostly black to mostly yellowish brown; mesosoma always with extensive orangish brown; differing from most other species in that all specimens have extensive pale whitish yellow on all lateral terga
states.2: mottled black and brown except laterotergite 1 and margins of most metasomal sclerites whitish, otherwise metasoma mostly brown
states.3: mottled dark brown and yellowish brown except laterotergite 1 and margins of most metasomal sclerites whitish, head and mesothorax predominantly yellowish brown
states.4: mostly black with reddish brown infusions on temple, lateral frons, tegula, and parts of legs; laterotergite 1 whitish; lower gena and malar space yellowish white
states.5: all black except: mandible and parts of all segments of fore- and midlegs reddish or yellowish brown, hind tibia reddish brown basally, laterotergite and sternum of metasomal tergum 1 whitish
states.6: mottled black and brown except laterotergite 1 and margins of most metasomal scleriters whitish, left and right sides of the holotype vary considerably with the right side much lighter
states.7: mottled black and brown except laterotergite 1 whitish, body, particularly metasoma, predominantly dark brown to black
states.8: mottled black and brown except laterotergite 1 whitish otherwise metasoma mostly brown
states.9: mottled dark brown and yellowish brown except laterotergite 1 whitish, otherwise metasoma mostly pale brown, head and mesothorax predominantly yellowish brown
states.10: mostly black with laterotergite 1 pale and the following areas yellowish brown: gena, posterodorsal apex of pronotum, tegula, legs except coxae and some tarsomeres
states.11: mottled black and brown except laterotergite 1 whitish, otherwise metasoma mostly brown

states.1: mostly weakly infuscate but less so anterobasally and at midlength (Fig. XXX)
states.2: clear basally, infuscate in apical half (Fig. XXX)

states.1: entirely black (Fig. XXX)
states.2: partly or entirely brown (Fig. XXX)

states.1: entirely black except tegula variable
states.2: partly or entirely brown

states.1: flared apicoanteriorly with expanded apical surface
states.2: not flared apicoanteriorly and lacking expanded apical surface

states.1: deep (Fig. XXX)
states.2: shallow (Fig. XXX)

states.1: entirely smooth with weak punctures (Fig. XXX)
states.2: smooth with weak punctures medially, weakly and irregularly transverse-striate laterally (Fig. XXX)
states.3: mostly smooth lacking punctures and microsetae, with very weak irregular sculpture laterally (Fig. XXX)
states.4: smooth medially, transversely striate laterally (Fig. XXX)
states.5: variable, from mostly transverse-striate, to mostly smooth with punctures (Fig. XXX)
states.7: rugose medially, smooth laterally except with few transverse striae immediately posterad antennal insertion (Fig. XXX)
states.8: entirely transversely rugosostriate somewhat smoother dorsomedially (Fig. XXX)

states.1: entirely rugose (Fig. XXX)
states.2: mostly smooth with weak punctures (Fig. XXX)

states.1: with median tooth
states.2: without median tooth

states.1: with weak rugose microsculpture (Fig. XXX)
states.2: mostly smooth with weak punctures (Fig. XXX)
states.3: with wide irregular punctures, lacking distinct rugose striae (Fig. XXX)
states.4: transversely rugosostriate anteriorly, longitudinally rugosostriate posteriorly (Fig. XXX)
states.5: entirely longitudinally rugosostriate, striae weaker posteriorly (Fig. XXX)
states.6: transversely rugosostriate anteriorly, rugosopunctate at midlength, longitudinally rugosostriate posteriorly (Fig. XXX)

states.1: mostly punctate with some weak rugae especially dorsally (Fig. XXX)
states.2: weakly punctate throughout (Fig. XXX)

12.description: area between antennal scrobe and inner orbit of eye <protuberance>

states.1: with protuberance (Fig. XXX)
states.2: without protuberance (Fig. XXX)

states.1: with distinct crenulate margin (Fig. XXX)
states.2: lacking distinct crenulate margin (Fig. XXX)

states.1: entirely smooth with punctures
states.2: entirely rugosopunctate
states.3: smooth with punctures anteromedially, otherwise rugosopunctate

states.1: entirely crenulate
states.2: crenulations weak and partly effaced

states.1: entirely rugosopunctate or rugose
states.2: at least partly smooth with punctures

states.1: long occupying most of length of mesopleuron (Fig. XXX)
states.2: only present at midlength (Fig. XXX)
states.3: absent or difficult to discern due to dense sculpture of mesopleuron (Fig. XXX)

19.description: discrimin (median longitudinal ventral sulcus between mesopleura) <sculpture>

states.1: smooth or with a few barely perceptible crenulae
states.2: crenulate

states.1: mostly rugose, lacking a large smooth lightly punctate area
states.2: partly rugose but with a large smooth lightly punctate area

states.1: mostly rugose with smooth area posterolaterally (Fig. XXX)
states.2: entirely rugose without smooth area posterolaterally (Fig. XXX)

states.1: distinctly narrowed posteriorly
states.2: not distinctly narrowed posteriorly

states.1: completely rugose
states.2: partly smooth with punctures especially posteriorly, with weak rugae or microsculpture anteriorly

states.1: subequal to half length of metasoma (Fig. XXX)
states.2: less than 1/3 length of metasoma (Fig. XXX)

states.1: extending past apical tergum (Fig. XXX)
states.2: not extending past apical tergum (Fig. XXX)

states.1: more than half as long as metasoma
states.2: barely exerted, much shorter than metasoma

27.description: length of setae of ovipositor sheath

states.1: none longer than 2x width of ovipositor sheath (Fig. XXX)
states.2: as much as 3 or 4x as long as width of sheath (Fig. XXX)

states.1: notauli crenulations weak and partly effaced (Fig. XXX)
states.2: mesopleuron entirely rugosopunctate or rugose (Fig. XXX); middle lobe of scutum entirely smooth with punctures (Fig. XXX)
states.3: mesopleuron at least partly smooth with punctures (Fig. XXX); notauli entirely crenulate; mesosoma partly or entirely brown; median tergite 1 completely rugose (Fig. XXX)
states.4: body of mesosoma entirely black except tegula brown (Fig. XXX)
states.5: tergite 1 partly smooth with punctures posteriorly; notauli entirely crenulate (Fig. XXX)
states.6: middle lobe of scutum entirely rugosopunctate; mesopleuron entirely rugosopunctate (Fig. XXX)
states.7: middle lobe of scutum smooth with punctures anteromedially, otherwise rugosopunctate (Fig. XXX); mesopleuron entirely rugosopunctate (Fig. XXX)
states.8: discrimen smooth or with a few barely perceptible crenulae (Fig. XXX); metapleuron partly rugose but with a large smooth lightly punctate area (Fig. XXX)
states.9: discrimen smooth or with a few barely perceptible crenulae; metapleuron mostly rugose, lacking a large smooth lightly punctate area (Fig. XXX)
states.10: scape not flared apicoanteriorly and lacking expanded apical surface (Fig. XXX); discrimen crenulate (Fig. XXX); mesosoma partly or entirely brown (Fig. XXX)
states.11: scape flared apicoanteriorly with expanded apical surface; median tergite 1 distinctly narrowed posteriorly and completely rugose
states.12: scape flared apicoanteriorly with expanded apical surface (Fig. XXX); median tergite 1 distinctly narrowed posteriorly and smooth with punctures posterolaterally (Fig. XXX)
states.13: mesosoma entirely black except tegula variable (Fig. XXX); median tergite 1 smooth with punctures posterolaterally (Fig. XXX)
states.14: mesosoma entirely black except tegula variable (Fig. XXX)
